intro: Astrochlaena hyoscyamoides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its attractive, clustered inflorescences. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Astrochlaena hyoscyamoides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
